DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapy Vitamin D Supplement Current Cycle Administered Estimated Daily Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The estimated measured amount given each day for the current cycle of non-protocol vitamin D supplement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Protocol Therapy D Vitamin Dietary Supplement Current Cycle Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets._Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: D Vitamin Dietary Supplement Current Cycle Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets.:Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.:Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A family of lipo-soluble steroids important to the absorption, metabolism, and function of calcium and phosphorus and the growth and development of bone and tooth enamel. Found naturally in animal tissues, cholecalciferol (vitamin D3) is formed in the skin when ultraviolet light activates cholesterol conversion into vitamin D3. Ultraviolet irradiation of ergosterol (plant vitamin D) forms ergocalciferol (vitamin D2). (NCI04)
Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.
Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The estimated measured amount of a supplement given each day.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Occurring or done each day.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
